citation.article-title: A taxonomic study of Thermomonospora and other monosporic actinomycetes

p.s: Description of Thermomonospora chromogena comb. nov. nom. rev.

Synonyms : 'Actinobifida chromogena' Krasilnikov & Agre, 1965 ; 'Thermomonospora falcata' Henssen, 1970. Type strain Agre no. 577 (NCIB 10212). Colonies on nutrient media small, entire, raised and dark reddish-brown to light brown in colour. Aerial mycelium white to light-brownish, turning blue-grey on prolonged incubation at 50 °C. Single spores formed on the aerial hyphae. Optimum temperature for growth 42 to 50 °C and optimum pH 7.0 to 9-0. The following compounds are degraded: keratin, elastin, xylan, arbutin, aesculin, xanthine, hypoxanthine, tyrosine (melanin not produced) and carboxymethyl cellulose. Starch, agar and chitin are not attacked. Catalase activity is weak; oxidase activity, strong; nitrate is reduced to nitrite; sucrose and glycerol are not utilized as sole carbon sources.
